tool.name: FileMerger
tool.description: Merges several MS files into one file.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ${ ' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in/%s.%s' &&" % (_, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _]) } mkdir out && #if $rt_concat.trafo_out_FLAG: mkdir rt_concat_trafo_out && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && export PYTHONPATH='$__tool_directory__/CTDopts/' && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in ${' '.join(["'in/%s.%s'"%(re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _])} -out 'out/output.${out_type}' #if $rt_concat.trafo_out_FLAG: -rt_concat:trafo_out ${' '.join(["'rt_concat_trafo_out/%s.%s'"%(re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext("trafoxml")) for _ in $in if _])} #end if
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${out_type}' '$out' #if $rt_concat.trafo_out_FLAG: ${' '.join(["&& mv -n 'in/%(id)s.%(gext)s' 'rt_concat_trafo_out/%(id)s'"%{"id": re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), "gext": $gxy2omsext("trafoxml")} for _ in $rt_concat.trafo_out if _])} #end if #if $adv_opts_cond.adv_opts_selector=='advanced' and $adv_opts_cond.ctd_out_FLAG && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: out_type
param.label: File type of output out (Output file)

param.name: annotate_file_origin
param.label: Store the original filename in each feature using meta value "file_origin" (for featureXML and consensusXML only)

section.name: rt_concat
section.title: Options for concatenating files in the retention time (RT) dimension
section.help: The RT ranges of inputs are adjusted so they don't overlap in the merged file (traML input not supported)

param.name: gap
param.label: The amount of gap (in seconds) to insert between the RT ranges of different input files
param.help: RT concatenation is enabled if a value > 0 is set

param.name: trafo_out_FLAG
param.label: Generate output trafo_out (Output of retention time transformations that were applied to the input files to produce non-overlapping RT ranges)
param.help: If used, one output file per input file is required

section.name: raw
section.title: Options for raw data input/output (primarily for DTA files)

param.name: rt_auto
param.label: Assign retention times automatically (integers starting at 1)

param.name: rt_custom
param.label: List of custom retention times that are assigned to the files
param.help: The number of given retention times must be equal to the number of input files (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: rt_filename
param.label: Try to guess the retention time of a file based on the filename
param.help: This option is useful for merging DTA files, where filenames should contain the string 'rt' directly followed by a floating point number, e.g. 'my_spectrum_rt2795.15.dta'

param.name: ms_level
param.label: If 1 or higher, this number is assigned to spectra as the MS level
param.help: This option is useful for DTA files which do not contain MS level information

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

tool.help:
Merges several MS files into one file.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/documentation/TOPP_FileMerger.html
